metadata.title: 5155-1 -- BlueZ vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that BlueZ incorrectly handled the Discoverable status when a device is powered down. This could result in devices being powered up discoverable, contrary to expectations. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, Ubuntu 21.04, and Ubuntu 21.10. (CVE-2021-3658)  It was discovered that BlueZ incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause BlueZ to consume resources, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2021-41229)  It was discovered that the BlueZ gatt server incorrectly handled disconnects. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause BlueZ to crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2021-43400)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo ua fix USN-5155-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libbluetooth3 - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 bluez-tests - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 bluez-obexd - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 bluetooth - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 bluez - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 bluez-hcidump - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 bluez-meshd - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 bluez-cups - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 libbluetooth-dev - 5.60-0ubuntu2.1 No subscription required
